block.p: Constance Young and Warren Judah Lewis were married yesterday. Judge Arthur D. Spatt of Federal District Court in Central Islip, N.Y., officiated at the Down Town Association, a club in Manhattan.

The couple work in Los Angeles. The bride, 45, is a sales associate at Diamond Foam and Fabric, a retail store. The bridegroom, 47, is a screenwriter whose credits include ''The 13th Warrior'' and ''Black Rain.''
Constance Young and Warren Judah Lewis were married yesterday. Judge Arthur D. Spatt of Federal District Court in Central Islip, N.Y., officiated at the Down Town Association, a club in Manhattan.

The couple work in Los Angeles. The bride, 45, is a sales associate at Diamond Foam and Fabric, a retail store. The bridegroom, 47, is a screenwriter whose credits include ''The 13th Warrior'' and ''Black Rain.''

Ms. Young is keeping her name. She graduated from the University of California at Santa Cruz. She is the daughter of Elizabeth M. Young of Sands Point, N.Y., and the late Douglas F. Young, a justice of State Supreme Court in Mineola, N.Y. Her mother is a librarian at the Old Westbury, N.Y., campus of the New York Institute of Technology.

Mr. Lewis graduated from New York University. He is a son of Dr. Allan Lewis of Brooklyn and the late Rose Lewis. His father, now retired, practiced podiatry in Brooklyn. The bridegroom's mother taught at Public School 134 in Brooklyn.
